title: ERROR
description: Throws an exception with a custom message, optionally based on a specified condition. If a condition is provided, an exception is thrown only if the condition evaluates to TRUE.

parameters.name: … message
parameters.description: The error message for the exception to be thrown when the condition is met.

parameters.name: … condition_optional
parameters.description: A logical expression that determines whether the error should be triggered. If omitted, the error is always raised with the provided message.

examples:
ERROR(
    "Amount must be a number", NOT(IS_NUMERIC(Amount)),
    "Amount must be greater than zero", Amount <= 0
)
-- First pair: Raises an error if Amount is not a number.
-- Second pair: Raises an error if Amount is less than or equal to zero.

ERROR("Invalid")
-- Throw an exception with the message "Invalid" without a condition.
